9 cards ready to print font/back (on one pager). French & English version.


This method was originally suggested by Alex Faickney Osborn in 1953, and the acronym was developed by Bob Eberle in 1971 in his book SCAMPER: Games for Imagination Development.


The objective of the SCAMPER method is to draw inspiration from what already exists, whether it is an existing product, a problem, an idea, or an element of a product or service, in order to come up with new ideas. Each letter of the word SCAMPER is linked to a verb (question) to encourage further reflection, creativity and innovation.
